title: GTA Closes Down 103 Leisure Facilities
text:
Business & Finance | 7 August 2015 17:07 CET GTA Closes Down 103 Leisure Facilities By Daily Guide 
The Ghana Tourism Authority (GTA) has closed down about 103 leisure facilities in the Central Region for operating without licences. 
They include 64 hostels, 36 hotels and three restaurants. 
The three-day exercise was undertaken by officials of Ghana Tourism Authority in Accra and Cape Coast. 
The unlicensed facilities were situated in five districts of the Central region-Cape Coast, Komenda-Edina-Eguafo-Abrem (KEEA), Assin North, Mfantseman Municipalities and Twifo Atti Morkwa. 
The hostels that were closed down include: Students Villa Hostel, Adoration Hostel, Nana Abaka Hostel, among others situated near the University of Cape Coast (UCC). 
Speaking to BUSINESS GUIDE during the exercise, Alex Boakye of the GTA, said that the exercise would be undertaken frequently to ensure that people who operate such facilities obtain the necessary documents and licences. 
He hinted that the owners of the affected facilities would be made to pay a fine of GH¢500 before they would be permitted to pick up a form of GH¢20 to secure the necessary licences. 
Mr Boakye emphasized the need for operators of such facilities to abide by the rules.
